mkcd 19 Mar 2012

I was getting tired of constantly doing stuff like:

$ mkdir -p some/new/directory
$ cd some/new/directory

I was sure there’d be some command or option to just do it for me, but some googling didn’t yield anything like that. Instead, I found a link to this helpful little shell function:

mkcd () {
  mkdir -p "$*"
  cd "$*"
}

add it to your .bashrc and bam:

$ mkcd some/new/directory

Plus, it’s only one letter away from xkcd :)
